required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Adverse Effects of ALA-PDT for the Treatment of Moderate to Severe Acne Vulgaris: a Prospective Study
clinical_study.official_title: Adverse Effects of ALA-PDT for the Treatment of Moderate to Severe Acne

brief_summary.textblock: To understand, prevent and treat the adverse reactions more comprehensively, we sought to systemically document the adverse effects of ALA-PDT for moderate to severe acne vulgaris.

detailed_description.textblock: To understand, prevent and treat the adverse reactions more comprehensively, we sought to systemically document the adverse effects of ALA-PDT for moderate to severe acne vulgaris.

study_design_info.masking_description: Evaluator assesses photographs without prior knowledge of intervention

primary_outcome.description: The change rate in lesion clearance of acne vulgaris at 7 days after treatment will be measured as the primary outcome

secondary_outcome.description: the incidence, severity, occurrence and duration time of erythema, pain, burning skin, itching, pustule, exudation, edema, blister, dry skin, crust and hyperpigmentation of last treatment, as well as lesion photos were detailed asked and recorded during the clinical encounter, up to 7 days after treatment.

arm_group.description: The conventional photodynamic therapy(C-PDT) group underwent narrow-band light-emitting diode (LED) irradiation (630 nm; 140 J/cm2) after applying 5% 5-aminolevulinic acid cream for 3h.A repeat treatment was administered once every two weeks for 3 times.
